channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. sledder Katie Uhlaender appeal denied, won't race at Milan Cortina Olympics
item.description: International officials say a point-rigging scheme denied American Katie Uhlaender a shot to compete in the Milan Cortina Olympics. But a sports tribu...

item.title: Trump administration sued over visa freeze on immigrants from 75 countries
item.description: A group of nonprofit organizations and U.S. citizens Monday filed a lawsuit challenging the Trump administration's sweeping suspension of immigrant vi...

item.title: The Trump Administration exempts new nuclear reactors from environmental review
item.description: The announcement comes just days after NPR revealed the administration had secretly rewritten safety and environmental standards.

item.title: What Jared Kushner's 'New Gaza' plan includes, and what it leaves out
item.description: President Trump's son-in-law Jared Kushner laid out a plan for a "New Gaza." A close look suggests it makes room for fewer Palestinians and less housi...

item.title: Populist conservative Laura Fernández wins Costa Rica's presidential election
item.description: Candidate Laura Fernández won a resounding victory, promising to continue the aggressive reorienting of the Central American nation's politics started...

item.title: Israel reopens Gaza's key Rafah border crossing with Egypt
item.description: Only dozens of Palestinians and no goods will be able to cross in both directions each day.

item.title: Kennedy Center to close for construction for 2 years, Trump says
item.description: Complete closure of the performing arts center in Washington, D.C., will start on July 4, Mr. Trump said. It's not yet clear how extensive the changes...

item.title: Ghana suspends citizenship process for people of African descent
item.description: Since 2016, those who can prove their ancestors came from Africa have been able to get Ghanaian nationality.

item.title: Takeaways from the millions of newly released Epstein files
item.description: Three million new documents include hundreds of mentions of Trump and emails between Epstein and a person called "The Duke".

item.title: Target faces pressures to take a stand against ICE's actions in Minneapolis
item.description: The American Federation of Teachers called on Target CEO Michael Fiddelke to "clearly state" that the company wants ICE agents to leave Minnesota.

item.title: BBC reports from Oslo court ahead of rape trial of Crown Princess's son
item.description: Norway's royal family has been embroiled in recent scandals, including Crown Princess Mette-Marit links with Epstein.

item.title: NASA fueling test for moon rocket runs into trouble with hydrogen leak
item.description: It's not yet known whether the hydrogen leak encountered Monday will impact the moonshot's eventual launch date.

item.title: Crown Princess's son arrested for alleged assault before rape trial in Norway
item.description: Marius Borg Høiby, who goes on trial on Tuesday, has been remanded in custody for four weeks after new allegations.

item.title: New Target CEO facing anti-ICE protests and slumping sales
item.description: New Target CEO Michael Fiddelke is facing pressure to take a stand against actions by Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents in Minneapolis, where...

item.title: Funding fight turns to the House as lawmakers look to avoid lengthy shutdown
item.description: The House is back in Washington on Monday to begin considering a revised funding package to end the partial government shutdown.

item.title: Man sentenced to 4 years in prison for throwing Molotov cocktail during LA immigration protest
Mayor of Portland, Oregon, demands ICE leave the city after federal agents gas protesters
5-year-old Liam Conejo Ramos and father return to Minnesota from ICE facility in Texas
item.description: Five-year-old Liam Conejo Ramos and his father have returned to Minnesota after being released by U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement.
